current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To prohibit Federal agencies from requiring seafood to be
		  certified as sustainable by a third party nongovernmental organization and for
		  other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

short-title.#text:
Responsible Seafood Certification
			 and Labeling Act

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

header.#text:
Prohibition on
			 seafood sustainability certification requirements

text.#text:
require or
			 reference a certificate of sustainability, or otherwise identify as
			 sustainable, based on criteria or standards developed by a third party
			 nongovernmental organization in awarding a contract for—

the procurement
			 of fish or seafood; or

concessions or
			 vending, including the sale of fish or seafood; or

endorse the use
			 of any label, standard, or other scheme to certify fish or seafood as
			 sustainable based on criteria or standards developed by a third party
			 nongovernmental organization.

term.#tail: has the meaning given that term in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, that
			 requires or recommends that fish or seafood be certified as sustainable by a
			 third party nongovernmental organization shall have any force or effect,
			 including any rule, regulation, or guideline issued prior to the date of the
			 enactment of this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Department of Health and Human Services

text.#text:
No rule, regulation, or guideline issued by an
			 executive agency, including the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1521 IS: Responsible Seafood Certification and Labeling Act

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
